description:
As the Leader in Recruiting Intelligence, The Edens Group, LLC has been retained to identify and recruit a dynamic and experienced SVP Executive Leader to assume the role of Head of Growth, reporting directly to the COO. Our client is a customer-obsessed, non-traditional, agile business with a purposeful focus on Distributed Data Systems, Platforms at Scale, and Complex Application Development. Their headquarters are in Reston, VA. Our client boasts a range of healthy customers including innovative federal and public agencies leveraging design thinking, cutting-edge tech stacks, and cloud-native ecosystems. They build robust, disruptive, digital solutions that impact the lives of millions of Americans. Of important note, and as an engineering-first-based company, our client’s core philosophy is working as a hyper-collaborative team where each team member brings a unique perspective, adding value and input that is rewarded and championed. Their devotion to the practice of innovation and collaboration coupled with the celebration of cognitive and cultural diversity makes them a truly unique entity.

Role Specificity:

The SVP of BD will be responsible for our client’s P&L and will drive the achievement of KPIs and business growth through targeted collaboration with the C Suite. The SVP of BD will play a critical role in continually iterating a Strategic Plan, Growth Pipeline, and organic playbooks to realize Enterprise Value using proven growth and business development performance benchmarks.

The SVP of BD will report to the COO and collaborate with the C Suite to meet strategic targets and performance benchmarks.

Key Responsibilities:

Design and Implement the corporate Growth Model to include the following:
• Work alongside the C Suite to achieve P&L objectives, driving accelerated growth in line with agreed upon target values
• Build an in-depth understanding of the Client Growth Model (including, pricing, technology innovation, marketing, M&A, etc.) and make strategic suggestions for how to prioritize and adapt growth levers to achieve the highest and most effective growth parameters
• Implement the Client Growth Model, driving key operational initiatives and demonstrating excellent cross-functional leadership and planning/execution expertise.
• Strong customer mindset with an ability to link customer roadmaps to strategic growth, pipeline development, and capture account plans.
• Build and maintain KPI dashboards and reports via the CRM to provide insight and transparency into performance; review these dashboards regularly with the C Suite and flag any potential negative leading indicators/risks/issues for slowing growth or other revenue quality issues
• Implement and help drive adoption of the people-first operating rhythm, ensuring that our client leverages Capture Account Plans, Gate Reviews, and Proposal Development efforts from strategic planning to opportunity identification to proposal submission and award notification until transition is complete
• Bring a mentality of continuous improvement to your work including conducting lessons learned after each proposal submission, developing a Gold Standard for business development and proposal activities, and coaching the team regarding appropriate methods to develop and retain levels of customer intimacy. Consistently evaluate current approaches and processes with the ultimate goal of seeking opportunities to drive efficiencies and improvements
• Define Growth performance benchmarks and report to C-Suite weekly and drive accountability throughout the Growth organization
• Extensive experience in business development, sales, marketing, or a related field, with a track record of driving growth and revenue, GTM strategy, and acquisition implementation
• Experience working with budgets and resources and the ability to manage and allocate resources to support growth initiatives effectively.

M&A Integration:
• Work alongside C-Suite and Consultants to define selection criteria for potential acquisitions to assist with Growth goals. Lead the effort from selection to closing
• Develop an integration playbook for potential acquisitions. Work collaboratively with C-Suite to fully integrate the acquisition based on agreed upon strategy
• Ensure seamless integration of tuck-in acquisitions, helping accelerate the path to realized value from adding team members and additional books of business
• Experience building presentations for potential acquisitions and presenting to investors.

Relationship Management & Team:
• Team members have a proven track record of driving revenue growth across multiple clients
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify opportunities and make data-driven decisions
• Excellent leadership abilities with the capacity to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams
• Develop incentives that promote a Win mentality
• Strong organizational, critical thinking and communication skills
• Build meaningful relationships up and down the organization
• Effectively, transparently communicate with relevant stakeholders, ensuring seamless collaboration on projects and day-to-day business operations
• Serve as a thought partner to the C Suite on all Growth matters
• Ensure that Our Client has A players in all key roles for driving future growth who consistently seek out opportunities- pounding the pavement to win the right kind of work to propel Our Client into accelerated growth and performance; backfill positions as needed
• Evaluate talent quality and repurpose, replace, or let go of individuals who are not well equipped for the future-state scorecard/role responsibilities

Intangible Characteristics Desired and Required:

· Leadership- Exhibits confidence in self and others. Inspires and motivates others to perform to the best of their ability. Effectively influences actions and opinions of others. Accepts feedback from others. Gives appropriate recognition to others. Seeks to effectively drive the decision-making process.

· Communication – Possesses the ability to convey information to others in a clear and understandable way. Responsible for communicating with employees, customers, investors, and other stakeholders.

· Strategic thinking: Bring the ability to see the big picture and understand how your work fits into the company’s goals and the long-term effects of your decisions and actions.

· Professionalism- Approaches others in a tactful manner. Reacts well under pressure. Treats other with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position. Accepts responsibility for their own actions and follows through on commitments.

· Standards of Excellence- Outstanding consultative and operational abilities and excellent interpersonal and presentation skills with executive level customers and partners. Proactive, resourceful and flexible in a fast-paced work environment, excellent work ethic including high results-orientation, attention to detail, strong customer focus and an exemplary level of professionalism.

Clearance Requirements:
• Ability to obtain and maintain a USG security clearance

Work Location:

Headquartered in Reston, VA, our client has outgrown their current space and is looking to double the corporate HQ (nearby in NoVA) and will be adding a SCIF capability as they expand.

Compensation and Benefits:
• Highly competitive Base Salary ($250-300K), Double Digit Bonus, Equity and additional Exec perks
• Fully covered healthcare, dental, and vision coverage + 401(k)
• Unlimited PTO + 11 paid holidays
• Education & training benefits, referral bonuses
• Annual budget for your tech/gadgets needs

Vision Market Statement:

Our client bridges the gap between humans and data through radical transparency and their true obsession with the USG’s mission. Our client is known for approaching every deliverable like it's a product. As they grow, and their footprint becomes larger, teams and employees will treat each other not only as teammates but customers. They collectively agree as a company that they must live the customer-obsessed mindset, always and first. This mantra adoption will help them rapidly scale and it will translate to the interactions that their employees have with their clients and other product teams with whom they integrate. Public-sector modernization is critical for all to live in a better world. Within our client, innovating and solving complex problems is at the root of all activity where the ultimate goal is for our generation and the ones that follow to live in an efficient, and accessible world where out-of-box thinking, and collaboration is the norm.

Our client is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor.
